title: How Recode's Shark Tank Rejection Boosted Its Growth ? - Indian Retailer
summary: The article discusses how Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) brands in India are ramping up their offerings, tech capabilities, and supply chains to meet the pent-up demand during the festive season. Companies like Solethreads and Zouk are focusing on sustainable and eco-friendly products while expanding their inventory and digital presence. The brands emphasize their innovative designs and processes to enhance customer experience and reach during this high-demand period. Overall, D2C brands are positioning themselves for significant growth this festive season.
green_innovation: TRUE - The article highlights companies like Solethreads that offer sustainable and recycled footwear, promoting upcycling and circular fashion, which contributes to environmental sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE - The article describes new and improved product offerings and business processes introduced by D2C brands, such as Solethreads and Zouk, which are significantly different from their previous offerings.
green_product: TRUE - Solethreads produces sustainable and recycled footwear that minimizes environmental impacts throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE - The companies implement processes like the 'reuse program' for upcycling old footwear, which promotes sustainability and resource conservation.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 448190 - Other Clothing Stores; 424990 - Other Miscellaneous Nondurable Goods Merchant Wholesalers; 541430 - Graphic Design Services; 454110 - Electronic Shopping and Mail-Order Houses
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not provide evidence of misleading statements regarding environmental benefits; rather, it focuses on genuine sustainable practices and innovations by the companies.

title: SS Beauty to Bank on Aggressive Omnichannel Model, to reach 25 Doors by Next Fiscal: Biju Kassim, President ... - Indian Retailer
summary: The article discusses the growth and strategies of various beauty and personal care brands in India during 2022. It highlights SUGAR Cosmetics, The Body Shop, Plum, Colorbar, and others as they expand their product lines and market presence, implementing innovative strategies to enhance customer engagement and sales. The beauty and personal care segment is projected to grow at a significant rate in the coming years, emphasizing the ongoing evolution of consumer preferences and purchasing behavior. Brands are also focusing on sustainability and digital experiences to cater to modern customers.
green_innovation: FALSE - The article does not provide clear examples of innovations that significantly reduce environmental impacts, as the focus is primarily on market strategies and sales growth of various beauty brands rather than specific environmental sustainability practices.
business_innovation: TRUE - The article details the introduction of new and improved products and business processes by beauty brands, such as the expansion of physical retail presence and new product launches, which align with the definition of business innovation.
green_product: FALSE - The article does not specify any particular good or service that is designed or manufactured in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: FALSE - The article does not mention any specific method or technique in manufacturing or production that minimizes environmental impacts or promotes sustainability in the processes used by the brands.
company: SUGAR Cosmetics, The Body Shop, Plum, Colorbar, Kapiva, Earth Rhythm, ARATA, BlushBee, Crazy Owl - Your Skin Co, Pilgrim, iluvia
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325620 - Toilet Preparation Manufacturing, 446120 - Cosmetics, Beauty Supplies, and Perfume Stores, 423850 - Service Establishment Equipment and Supplies Merchant Wholesalers, 424210 - Drugs and Druggists' Sundries Merchant Wholesalers
